t2.title: Getting Started With D4ST Docker
t2.desc:
The DITA for Small Teams Docker containers make it easy to set up a complete D4ST
    environment on any machine using the Docker container technology.

t3.title: D4ST Container Quick Start
t3.desc:
If you are familiar with Docker you can follow these instructions to get going as
    quickly as possible.
t3.keywords: d4st docker d4st d4st d4st d4st log-gitlab d4st $PWD d4st d4st d4st $PATH echo d4st d4st make-gitlab-user git push d4st linkmgr

t4.title: Setting Up Command Completion for the d4st Command
t4.desc:
You can set up tab completion for the parameters to the d4st
    command.

t5.title: Extending the D4ST Docker System
t5.desc:
It is easy to extend or modify the D4ST system by defining your own containers that
    build on the base containers.

t6.title: Building the D4ST Containers
t6.desc:
The base D4ST containers are built automatically by the Docker hub site but you can
    build containers directly using the docker build command.
t6.keywords:
docker build docker build docker
 build

t7.title: D4ST Development Guide
t7.desc: How to set up and manage your D4ST Docker development environment.

t8.title: Source Project Organization
t8.desc:
How to organize the various GitHub projects that contribute to the D4ST Docker
    system.

t9.title: Local Docker Development Setup
t9.desc:
How to configure the running D4ST Docker containers to make development
    easy.

t10.title: Building, Testing, and Releasing Updated Containers
t10.desc: How to build new versions of the various D4ST Docker containers.
t10.keywords: docker build docker-compose d4st d4st pull d4st start

t11.title: D4ST Container System Description
t11.desc:
The D4ST container system is composed from a set of Docker containers where each
    container provides a separate component of the complete D4ST system.

t13.title: D4ST System Configuration
t13.desc:
Using the D4ST containers requires a little bit of configuration to reflect the details
    of where you have the containers deployed, as well as component-specific configuration that
    reflects your publication development details.

t14.title: Docker Container Reference
t14.desc:
The following Docker containers are used by the DITA for Small Teams setup documented in
    this guide.

t15.title: D4ST DITA Open Toolkit Docker Container
t15.desc: The d4st/dita-ot container provides a generic DITA Open Toolkit image.

t16.title: D4ST Link Manager BaseX Docker Container
t16.desc:
The d4st/link-manager-basex container provides a BaseX HTTP server configured with the
    DITA for Small Teams Link Manager application.

t17.title: D4ST GitLab Docker Container
t17.desc:
The d4st/gitlab container provides a fully-featured instance of the GitLab git server
    and GitLab continous Integration (CI) server.
